com.wit.android.widget.adapter

Class SimpleCursorAdapter<C extends android.database.Cursor>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.internal.BaseWidgetAdapter
        • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.BaseAdapter
          • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.SimpleCursorAdapter<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - Type of the cursor which will represents data set for this adapter.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, AdapterOptimizer.OptimizedAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCursorMultiAdapter

    public abstract class SimpleCursorAdapter<C extends android.database.Cursor>
extends BaseAdapter

        Creates new instance of SimpleCursorAdapter with the given context.

        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be this adapter used.

      • SimpleCursorAdapter

        public SimpleCursorAdapter(android.content.Context context,
                   C cursor)

        Creates new instance of SimpleCursorAdapter with the given context and cursor as data set for this adapter.

        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be this adapter used.
        cursor - Cursor as data set for this adapter.

    • Method Detail

      • hasCursor

        public boolean hasCursor()

        Checks whether this adapter has valid cursor or not.

        Returns:
        True if this adapter's cursor is valid, false otherwise.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

        Checks whether this adapter has valid cursor and that cursor has some items or not.

        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface android.widget.Adapter
        Overrides:
        isEmpty in class android.widget.BaseAdapter
        Returns:
        True if this adapter's cursor is valid and has some items, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        hasCursor()

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        See Also:
        hasCursor()

      • getItem

        public java.lang.Object getItem(int position)

        Same as getCursorAt(int).

      • getCursorAt

        public C getCursorAt(int position)

        Returns the current cursor moved to the requested position.

        Parameters:
        position - The position, to which should be cursor moved.
        Returns:
        The current cursor moved to the requested position or null if cursor can't be moved to that position because it isn't valid or doesn't have any items.
        See Also:
        hasCursor()

      • getCursor

        public C getCursor()

        Returns the current cursor.

        Returns:
        The current cursor of this adapter.

      • swapCursor

        public C swapCursor(C cursor)

        Like changeCursor(android.database.Cursor), but this will return the current cursor (not closed) of this adapter.

        Parameters:
        cursor - A new cursor for this adapter.
        Returns:
        The current cursor of this adapter.
        See Also:
        changeCursor(android.database.Cursor)

      • changeCursor

        public void changeCursor(C cursor)

        Changes the current cursor of this adapter by the given one. The current cursor will be closed before it changes for the new one.

        Parameters:
        cursor - A new cursor for this adapter.
        See Also:
        swapCursor(android.database.Cursor)

      • onSetUpItemView

        public void onSetUpItemView(int position,
                   java.lang.Object viewHolder)
        Description copied from interface: AdapterOptimizer.OptimizedAdapter

        Invoked to set up and populate a view for an item from this optimized adapter's data set at the specified position. This is invoked whenever Adapter.getView(int, android.view.View, android.view.ViewGroup) on this adapter is called.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of item within this optimized adapter's data set.
        viewHolder - Same type of holder as provided by AdapterOptimizer.OptimizedAdapter.onCreateItemViewHolder(int, android.view.View) for the specified position.

      • reloadCursor

        protected final boolean reloadCursor(C cursor)

        Reloads the current cursor of this adapter as data set.

        Parameters:
        cursor - A new cursor for this adapter..
        Returns:
        True if cursor was successfully reloaded, false otherwise. For now this will always return true.

      • moveCursorTo

        protected boolean moveCursorTo(int position)

        Moves the current cursor of this adapter to the requested position.

        Parameters:
        position - Position to move cursor to.
        Returns:
        True if cursor was moved to requested position, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        hasCursor()

      • onBindItemView

        protected abstract void onBindItemView(int position,
                  C cursor,
                  java.lang.Object viewHolder)

        Invoked to set up and populate a view for an item at the specified position of this adapter's cursor. This is invoked whenever onSetUpItemView(int, Object) on this adapter is called and the current cursor was successfully moved to the specified position by moveCursorTo(int).

        Parameters:
        position - The position of item within this optimized adapter's cursor.
        cursor - The current cursor of this adapter moved to the specified position.
        viewHolder - Same type of holder as provided by AdapterOptimizer.OptimizedAdapter.onCreateItemViewHolder(int, android.view.View) for the specified position.
